fields.title: probability
fields.pointers:
*  [Random variables](random_variables)  are probably the most central object of probability theory.
* A more rigorous mathematical basis for probability theory is built on  [measure theory](measure_theoretic_probability) .
fields.summary: Probability theory is a set of mathematical techniques for reasoning about uncertainty. Intuitively, probabilities can be thought of as describing long-run frequencies or subjective beliefs. Mathematically, a probability measure is a function on subsets of a sample space which satisfy certain axioms.
